Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the DXC006 clinical trial?
A) A routine medical treatment for advanced solid tumors and hematologic malignancies.
B) A non-research related health assessment program.
C) A Phase I clinical research study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and efficacy of DXC006.
D) A commercially available drug therapy for general public use.

Correct answer: C) A Phase I clinical research study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and efficacy of DXC006.

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the expected duration of a subject's participation in the DXC006 clinical trial?
A) Up to 6 months; B) Up to 12 months; C) Up to 18 months; D) Up to 24 months

Correct answer: B

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding additional costs that the subject may incur as a result of participating in the research study described in the new consent form?
A) The subject will be responsible for all medical expenses related to the trial, including laboratory tests and imaging tests.
B) The subject will receive compensation for blood sampling and inpatient stays, as well as transportation compensation for visits to the hospital.
C) The subject will have to pay for the investigational drug DXC006 and any associated treatment and examination procedures.
D) The sponsor will cover all costs related to the study, and no compensation will be provided to the subject for participation.

Correct answer: B) The subject will receive compensation for blood sampling and inpatient stays, as well as transportation compensation for visits to the hospital.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
Which of the following statements accurately describes the procedures that participants will undergo during the DXC006 clinical trial?

A) Participants will be required to undergo a series of tests including blood tests, urinalysis, and fecal routine tests only once before the start of the trial.
B) Participants will receive DXC006 via intravenous infusion and will be monitored through various tests at specific intervals throughout the trial, including drug concentration monitoring and immunogenicity testing.
C) Participants will be asked to provide a bone marrow aspirate only if they have a history of extramedullary plasmacytoma or relevant clinical symptoms.
D) Participants will be compensated RMB 200 for each hospital visit, regardless of the number of visits or hospitalizations during the study.

Correct answer: B) Participants will receive DXC006 via intravenous infusion and will be monitored through various tests at specific intervals throughout the trial, including drug concentration monitoring and immunogenicity testing.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Questions:
What will happen if you choose to withdraw from the DXC006 clinical trial at any point?
A) You will be required to reimburse the cost of the study drug and medical procedures; B) You may be subject to legal action by the sponsor; C) Your normal medical treatment will not be affected and you will not face any discrimination or retaliation; D) You will lose access to all medical care provided by the study hospital.

Correct answer: C

Topics: Identification of any procedures which are experimental
Questions:
Which of the following is an experimental procedure being investigated in the DXC006 clinical trial?
A) Standard chemotherapy for solid tumors and hematologic malignancies
B) Use of DXC006 to evaluate its safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics, and efficacy in patients with advanced solid tumors and hematologic malignancies
C) Routine blood pressure and heart rate monitoring
D) Administration of approved monoclonal antibody treatments for cancer

Correct answer: B

Topics: The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many patients are expected to be enrolled in the dose escalation phase of the DXC006 clinical trial?
A) 30; B) 40; C) 50; D) 60
Correct answer: C) 50

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential risk or discomfort that participants may experience during the DXC006 clinical trial?
A) Guaranteed improvement in their condition; B) Adverse reactions related to the study drug; C) Mandatory long-term hospitalization; D) Automatic enrollment in future clinical trials

Correct answer: B) Adverse reactions related to the study drug

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the potential benefits that subjects may experience from participating in the DXC006 clinical trial?

A) Subjects will definitely experience relief from their solid tumors and hematologic malignancies as a direct result of participating in the trial.
B) Subjects may or may not benefit from the trial, but the information gathered may help improve future treatments for patients with similar conditions.
C) Subjects will receive financial compensation for participating, which is the only benefit guaranteed by the trial.
D) All subjects will receive a new, FDA-approved treatment for their condition as a benefit of participating in the trial.

Correct answer: B) Subjects may or may not benefit from the trial, but the information gathered may help improve future treatments for patients with similar conditions.

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
Questions:
What are the alternative treatment options mentioned in the consent form for patients who choose not to participate in the DXC006 clinical trial?
A) Standard chemotherapy and radiation therapy for solid tumors and hematologic malignancies; B) Participation in another clinical trial with a different investigational drug; C) No alternative treatments are mentioned in the consent form; D) Immediate surgical intervention for tumor removal.

Correct answer: C) No alternative treatments are mentioned in the consent form.

Topics: A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained

For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What compensation is provided to participants if they experience injury as a result of taking part in the DXC006 clinical trial?
A) Free medical treatment for the injury and additional financial compensation
B) Only the medical treatments that are part of the study will be provided at no cost
C) Financial compensation for the injury as well as coverage of all medical expenses
D) The consent form does not specify any compensation for injuries related to the study

Correct answer: D) The consent form does not specify any compensation for injuries related to the study

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject
Questions:
If you experience any research-related injury during the study, whom should you notify first?
A) The Ethics Committee of the drug regulatory authority; B) The sponsor's representative; C) Your study doctor; D) The hospital administration

Correct answer: C) Your study doctor

Topics: A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
Which of the following statements is true regarding your participation in the DXC006 clinical trial?

A) Participation in the trial is mandatory once you sign the consent form.
B) You may face penalties or loss of medical benefits if you refuse to participate in the trial.
C) You can withdraw from the trial at any time without any impact on your standard medical care.
D) If you decide not to participate, your access to future medical treatments may be restricted.

Correct answer: C) You can withdraw from the trial at any time without any impact on your standard medical care.
